channel.title: Running a server on hamachi... refuses to connect
channel.description: For all you "use the search button" fanatics, I searched for similar topics and read through the whole port forwarding guide page that included setting up hamachi, but as I expected it did not include my problem, which is: I use to run my server off hamachi since my normal computer ip randomly stopped working one day. It ran fine, no issues ever. I come back after a while only to find I set up my server the same way, but even on my own computer, I can't connect to my server using the hamachi ip when I created the network and I am in the network. (Let alone my friends being able to join either). Has anyone else been through this problem? I honestly don't see why it's an issue. Firewalls are off, hamachi has all the connections it needs to make. It is the latest version of hamachi.

item.title: Running a server on hamachi... refuses to connect
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Oh those servers were awesome With disguise

But yes Please Avoid Hamachi only time i ever use it is for Vista Computers so they can connect on a network for Network games or Over like Dungeon Siege Or Starcraft 1 Older games so we can play over the internet with a Network type of Connection

Read full topic

item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

People still use hamachi? I havent or seen it since…cheesescape? phonoscape? lol, back when we trained on objects outside varrock bank.

If i were you i would just avoid hamachi if at all possible.

item.title: Running a server on hamachi... refuses to connect
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Wow i’ve never had that issue are you sure players are connected to your hamachi are typing in your Hamachi Ip address?

And your Port forwarding
I have had the same issue

there is a setting on some that says reset every couple of hours or somthing…
Just see if you have one of those buttons. and turn it off
